contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox flag |Name=Mauritania |Image=Flag of Mauritania.svg |Use= 111111 |Design = Green, with a golden upward-pointed crescent and star |Ratio= 2:3 |Adoption= April 1, 1959 }} The '''flag of Mauritania''' is the common name for the [[national flag]] of [[Mauritania]] in north-west [[Africa]]. The [[flag]] was adopted on April 1, 1959.<ref name="fotw">{{fotw|id=mr|title=(Flag of) Mauritania}} Accessed 27 August 2009.</ref> It was introduced under the instructions of [[Moktar Ould Daddah]],<ref>{{fotw|id=fr-colon|title=France: Colonial Empire}}. Jaume OllÃ© and Nozomi Kariyasu, 17 June 1998. Accessed 27 August 2009.</ref> and the subsequent constitution of 22 March 1959. ==Design== [[File:Photo Flag Mauritania.JPG|thumb|Waving flag of Mauritania]] The colors green and gold are considered [[Pan-African]] colors.<ref>{{fotw|id=x-panaf|title=Pan-African Colours}} Accessed 27 August 2009.</ref> Green is also used to symbolize Islam, and the gold for the sands of the [[Sahara]] desert. The [[crescent and star]] are symbols of [[Islam]], which is the major religion in the nation. Some writers have also speculated that green symbolises a bright future, and growth.<ref name="fotw"/> There is no official specification or construction sheet for the exact relative measurements of the star and crescent, although the flag's measurements are 2:3.<ref name="fotw"/> ==Use== The design acts as the national flag of Mauritania, and is also used in circular form as an aircraft roundel.<ref name="fotw"/> ==Legal basis== The [[Constitution of Mauritania|current constitution]] of 12 July 1991 specifies that:<ref name="icl">{{cite web|url=http://www.servat.unibe.ch/icl/mr00000_.html|title=Mauritania - Constitution|publisher=International Constitutional Law|date=12 July 1991|accessdate =27 August 2009}}</ref> {{quote|The national emblem is a flag with a crescent and a gold star on a green ground|12 July 1991|Constitution of Mauritania}} Unlike the seal, the exact flag is specified, not merely the right for a law to specify it at some later date.<ref name="icl"/> However, the flag has its official basis in the earlier constitution of 22 March 1959;<ref name="fotw"/> no changes were made after the country's declaration of independence in 1960.<ref>{{cite book|title=Flag lore of all nations|author=Whitney Smith|year=2001|page=62}} Available at Google Books, [http://books.google.co.uk/books?id=EFhAUbH6ra0C&pg=PA62 here] (accessed 27 August 2009).</ref> ==See also== *[[Coat of arms of Mauritania]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commonscat|Flags of Mauritania}} *{{FOTW|id=mr|title=Mauritania}} {{Arab Flags}} {{Africa topic|Flag of|title=[[Flags of Africa]]}} {{nationalflags}}<!-- to edit this table, go to [[Template:Nationalflags]] --> {{Mauritania topics}} [[Category:National symbols of Mauritania]] [[Category:National flags|Mauritania]] [[Category:1959 introductions]]
